verses.kjv: And I, brethren, when I came to you, came not with excellency of speech or of wisdom, declaring unto you the testimony of God.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, when I came to you, I didn't come with impressive eloquence or superior wisdom to share God's testimony with you.

verses.kjv: For I determined not to know any thing among you, save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.
verses.ct: I made up my mind to focus on nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and his death on the cross.

verses.kjv: And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.
verses.ct: I showed up feeling weak, nervous, and shaking with anxiety.

verses.kjv: And my speech and my preaching was not with enticing words of man’s wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:
verses.ct: My message and my preaching didn't rely on persuasive words based on human wisdom. Instead, they were backed by the demonstration of the Spirit and of power.

verses.kjv: That your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.
verses.ct: This was so that your faith would be grounded in God's power rather than in human wisdom.

verses.kjv: Howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the wisdom of this world, nor of the princes of this world, that come to nought:
verses.ct: Now, we do speak wisdom among those who are mature — but it's not the wisdom of this present age, and it's not from the rulers of this age, who are fading away.

verses.kjv: But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, even the hidden wisdom, which God ordained before the world unto our glory:
verses.ct: Instead, we speak God's wisdom, which has been hidden as a mystery — the secret wisdom that God planned before time began for our glory.

verses.kjv: Which none of the princes of this world knew: for had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
verses.ct: None of the rulers of this age understood it. If they had, they never would have crucified the Lord of glory.

verses.kjv: But as it is written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love him.
verses.ct: But as Scripture says, 'No eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no human mind has imagined the things that God has prepared for those who love him.'

verses.kjv: But God hath revealed them unto us by his Spirit: for the Spirit searcheth all things, yea, the deep things of God.
verses.ct: But God has revealed these things to us through his Spirit, because the Spirit explores everything, even the deepest realities of God.

verses.kjv: For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.
verses.ct: After all, who can understand a person's thoughts except that person's own spirit? In the same way, no one can understand God's thoughts except the Spirit of God.

verses.kjv: Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.
verses.ct: What we have received is not the spirit of the world but the Spirit who comes from God, so that we can understand the gifts God has freely given us.

verses.kjv: Which things also we speak, not in the words which man’s wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth; comparing spiritual things with spiritual.
verses.ct: These are the things we talk about — not using language that human wisdom teaches, but using language that the Holy Spirit teaches, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-given words.

verses.kjv: But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.ct: A person without the Spirit doesn't accept the things that come from the Spirit of God. They seem like nonsense to that person, and they can't grasp them because these things require spiritual discernment.

verses.kjv: But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.
verses.ct: The person who has the Spirit, however, can evaluate everything, yet no one without the Spirit can properly evaluate that person.

verses.kjv: For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him? But we have the mind of Christ.
verses.ct: For 'who has ever understood the mind of the Lord well enough to advise him?' But we share the mind of Christ.
